text_section1.text: Manpower from plantpower? The answer could rock the world! All you need is...
I didn't like professor Horace Googer, but then, who did? I went to see him, anyway. He was tops in bio-chemistry and a good business man never  turned down his discoveries...

text_section2.text: Oh, yes, I've got something astonishingly new!

text_section1.text: No -- it's in here!
It just looks like a white powder to me...
Not powder, Mister Fisher, but seed... countless grains of a strange, minute seed!
Googer placed a few grains under a great microscope and allowed me to peer into it --
'Interesting' was an understatement! The seeds were human in form!
Googer -- these are --

text_section2.text: Do you remember the legend of Cadmus? How he planted the teeth of a dragon in the ground?

text_section1.text: That's what I've got -- the dragon seeds of Cadmus! How I've developed it is my secret!
This is -- incredible, Googer!

text_section2.text: Then wait until you see the plants in my chemical gardens!

text_section1.text: Needless to say, the gardens were even more fantastic...
I - I can't believe it!

text_section2.text: Who cares! They're fine looking lads -- young -- strong! Like Cadmus, I'll have an army before long!

text_section1.text: That's what I've got to sell, Mister Fenwick -- an army... manpower... all I can grow!

text_section2.text: That's what I like about you Googer -- nothing!

text_section1.text: Heh - heh! Now, in this room I put the boys when they're fully grown and quite active!
They never tire! They like to fight -- they're powerful and aggressive --
Oh! One other detail... bullets can't hurt them, you know! -- You can't destroy plants with bullets -- and that's what they are -- plants!
I was frightened by what all this represented. In my mind were endless skirmish lines of these indestructibles marching across the world -- in the cause of some evil power!

text_section2.text: Googer -- I insist you put a stop to this!

text_section3.text: Nonsense! I need your business brains -- you can help me make millions!

text_section1.text: I didn't blame Horace Googer for wanting to make millions. But this product would bring the world a big headache! I considered using violence to stop him. However, one night, the fates did the job for me...
Googer had turned a wrong valve or something during an experiment and blew himself and his works sky-high! I was called soon after it happened...

text_section2.text: As far as we can determine, sir, it was just an unfortunate accident!

text_section3.text: Too bad. He was a brilliant man --

text_section1.text: Will you need me any further right now, lieutnant?

text_section2.text: Oh, yes, sir -- it's about the survivors --

text_section1.text: Survivors -- there were twenty of them -- they were in the hospital -- driving the doctor's mad trying to figure out what in blazes they were!
He was startled when I did --

text_section3.text: I'll assume full responsibility for them!

text_section1.text: I made a lot of money with those plant men. Only I didn't put them to the use that Googer intended...

text_section2.text: They're unbeatable in the pro-football league!

text_section1.text: The plant men took to competitive athletics like ducks to water! -- one of them became a contender for the heavyweight championship of the world!
Of course, it didn't quite end there. Among the few items salvaged from the explosion -- was a bag of the Cadmus seed...

text_section2.text: This isn't the sack Googer showed me!

text_section1.text: This must have been a new batch he made before he died!
I couldn't help getting curious. I took the sack to a research lab which had an electron microscope...

text_section2.text: You say the seeds resemble human embryos?

text_section3.text: They did when I saw them!

text_section1.text: It seems that Doctor Googer went a bit further in his later work --
Take a look for yourself!
I was stunned -- Googer needed human body cells for his experiments -- so he'd used his own!

text_section2.text: There must be several million Googers here!

text_section1.text: What do you do with a few million Googers? I don't know. I'm not going to grow any of them! I think one Horace Googer in this age was enough! The End.
